comment.author: 97828344@N00
comment._content: Technically this is a fjord rather than a bay.

comment.author: 64848937@N00
comment._content: It's known locally as Killary Harbour and as Kevin states resembles a Fjord.  As a past student of geography I have sat and listened to distinguished professors argue as to whether it really is a Fjord.  The general consensus is that it would be one if it were in the Nordics but as it is not then it is Fjord-like.  Don't you love the pedanticism of academia?  I remember in 1992 sitting on the edge of the site having a Mars bar and watching the beautiful vista when much to my surprise a submarine emerged from the Harbour.  It's well known amongst locals that the UK likes it's nuclear subs to practise in the harbour despite the fact that Ireland is a nuclear free zone.

comment.author: 15104821@N06
comment._content: I'm so happy to see someone from this era applying such beautiful composition in this shot.... check out those reflections!!!
